alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 24 at 8:14PM HST until January 25 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING FOR MAUNA KEA AND MAUNA LOA SUMMITS REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY CANCELLED FOR ALL OTHER AREAS... .Westerly winds over the summits and upper slopes of the Big Island will strengthen tonight, and remain dangerously strong through Thursday. Winds in the lower elevations have diminished. ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...West winds 40 to 60 mph with localized gusts over 75 mph. * WHERE...Big Island Summits. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can make driving and walking dangerous. The winds can forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries.
info.instruction: Be prepared for road-closures. Postpone travel to the summits until conditions improve.
